David Saff wrote:
> 
> ...TestClassRunner does not interpret
> any test classes as being atomic tests.
> 

If my custom runner applies a filter that filters out all the tests in a
class, I will get a failure (Exception - no tests run) when
TestClassMethodsRunner.run() (invoked from TestClassRunner via
BeforeAndAfterRunner) reaches "if (fTestMethods.isEmpty())
testAborted(notifier, getDescription());"

In order to avoid this, I've tried implementing the custom runner's run()
as:
   @Override
    public void run(RunNotifier notifier) {
        if (getDescription().getChildren().isEmpty()) {
            log("Warning: No tests found for class " + getDescription());
        } else {
            delegate.run(notifier);
        }
    } // run

This catches the no-tests-remain case, but it's an accident waiting to
happen if the test is atomic.  The condition really ought to be
"getDescription().testCount() == 0", but Description.testCount() is
implemented to return 1 if there are no children.

(As for my actually having an atomic test, I thought my Eclipse plugin
runner was giving me one in one of my test cases, but I haven't been able to
reproduce it.)

tnx.
